intro: Stilifolium cebolleta, commonly known as the Mexican garlic chive, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley, carrots, and dill. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves that emit a mild garlic scent when crushed. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Stilifolium cebolleta is often cultivated for its edible leaves and has traditional uses in Mexican cuisine.
